text: So my team and myself,

we build products, and
assets, and capabilities

for our clients to help
modernize their institutions
to be able to launch new products
and propositions out a lot quicker.

And we can even build a
bank from the ground up.

We're looking to solve
several challenges with AWS.

Some of them revolve around
customers themselves.
They want more tailored experiences.

They want products that
suit their needs directly.
There's also regulatory concerns,
so being able to have an architecture
and a solution that's scalable,
that reduces their cost,

but still gives them that
competitive advantage
is going to be key to their success.
We're releasing ESG rewards,

which is basically being
able to look at transactions

and match it up with
merchants that are compliant

and reward our customers
for using those merchants.
So it's a great win-win for both sides.
We also have our fabric,

which is the underpinning
of all our offerings.
So that gives us the scale that we need
and the ability for clients or ourselves

to build new propositions
a lot quicker on top of.
And we use this across all industries.

We chose AWS to build these
solutions for several reasons.
They have 200 plus services.

We feel they're actively
always listening to the market,
what are the needs,

and trying to figure out
ways to address that,

and also to innovate and
to take a step forward,
and say, "What can we expect in the future

to help our clients
and our customers out?"

AWS to our business means the
confidence to build solutions

and capabilities that are
secure, reliant, resilient.
And that gives us the sense of confidence

and credibility in the
market to go together.
